title: Postcard, 2000-61-2, 1986
description:
Sundial pop up used as the designer's "thank you"/promotion  card.  Originally designed in 1986; updated in 1993. 
Cover: S inside circle at center and horizontal cut-out slot at below center.  Black radial lines at top half and horizontal swirly lines at bottom half. Four interior pages.  
Page 1: Blank. Horizontal slot at center (labelled "b"). 
Page 2: Top part fold out (labelled "a") and to be inserted in horizontal cut-out on adjacent page.  Quarter circle at lower right numbered from "7-12".  Radial lines stemming from center of right edge where there is small semi-circle.  Small horizontal cut-out slot at bottom center (labelled "d").  
Page 3: Blank.  Small horizontal slot (labelled "d").
Page 4: Directions imprinted at top half in black.  "1 PLACE THE SUNDIAL CARD IN FRONT OF YOU/ 2 FOLD FLAP a UPRIGHT AND SLIDE IT INTO SLOT b./ FOLD TAB c UP AND SLIDE IN INTO THE SLOT d/ ADJUST THE LEVEL TO THE CITY YOU LIVE IN./ LET THE SUN SHINE.  TURN CARD UNTIL THE SHADOW/ SHOWS CORRECT TIME ON DIAL. HAVE A SUNNY DAY." At bottom, semi protractor-like fold out labelled "HONOLULU/ ATLANTA/ NEW YORK/ SEATTLE/  ANCHORAGE". 
Back cover: Divided in half.  Imprinted at top left, "SUNDIAL POSTCARD DESIGNED BY SAGMEISTER INC./ 222 WEST 14TH STREET #15A..." Across center, imprinted in vertical, "STYLE=FART BEAUTY=PRICE LOVE=OXYGEN".  On right side, three dotted lines at bottom half for address.
Pages closed by small white dot sticker.
